item.title: DoS
item.dc:creator: @The_AFKer The_AFKer
item.description:
@The_AFKer wrote:

If you’re seriously running Windows, you can just forget about ways to block attacks, especially if it’s DDoS. You’d be better off having SecurePort handle this on the network end.

Read full topic

item.title: DoS
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“snoopy89, post:30, topic:357957”]Its a DDoS, I can handle a Regular DDoS from LOIC.

The maximum packets that has come was 60 000 I believe, info taken from the Firewall log.
Im not sure what attack they are using but I would guess on PPS flood then.

If theres any chance to Log the packets from the bots ONLY then I might be able to block them.
But I can’t seem to separate the loging from regular players and bots

ATM I use a PHP script I found laying on Google named Tweety, What it does it TEMP banns the IP for 30 seconds, the site hasn’t been down for more then 1 min ever since. Not sure if this actually works or they just stopped DDoSing the site.[/quote]
Without knowing what type of attack you’re being hit by it is neigh on impossible to help you mitigate the attack. Some things you can do to find out what attack you’re being hit by are:

Trying to ping your server’s IP address when you’re being attacked - if you get high packet loss or complete packet loss then your server is either running out of bandwidth (udp flood) or shitting itself which could be caused by almost anything tbh ;p, it’s best to keep a remote desktop connection open to your server at all times so that you can see what it is doing (or not doing).

Checking apache’s log files - What you’re looking at here is anything which looks ‘out of the ordinary’, like the useragent string (if you’re not logging it, log it). A lot of bots won’t have any user agent (grab their IPs from the log and ban them, I did it for >1 year w/o a problem). You may also see lots of hits from custom UAs hitting the same page, you should grab their ips and ban them and then look at the page they’re attacking to see if you can recode it to be more efficient and therefore less susceptible to attack.

There’s way too many things that you can check for me to list them all here, but If anyone wants me to seriously secure their boxes as a network consultant or other adhoc work, give me a shout (:

Read full topic

item.title: DoS
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

Its a DDoS, I can handle a Regular DDoS from LOIC.

The maximum packets that has come was 60 000 I believe, info taken from the Firewall log.
Im not sure what attack they are using but I would guess on PPS flood then.

If theres any chance to Log the packets from the bots ONLY then I might be able to block them.
But I can’t seem to separate the loging from regular players and bots

ATM I use a PHP script I found laying on Google named Tweety, What it does it TEMP banns the IP for 30 seconds, the site hasn’t been down for more then 1 min ever since. Not sure if this actually works or they just stopped DDoSing the site.

Read full topic

item.title: DoS
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

DoS evasive does nothing. Don’t waste your time.

Funny, the apache module for ddos evasive works quite well actually…

Anyway snoopy, what TYPE of DoS attack.

A few types to pick from:

SYN flood
PPS flood (low payload , high amount of packets)
UDP flood (low packet count, high payload)
HTTP flood (pages of a website are refreshed constantly)

Also, is it a simple DoS or a DDoS? My guess would be a DDoS, because if you can’t stop a single attacker… meh.

Read full topic

item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

People need to stop Assuming by people I mean “bamboozola”
We went with Staminus for 2 reasons Making the game more smooth, and to try to prevent the site being DoS’d, and secure port and basic DDoS protection was include in that offer we got.

Alright kryptix, but there has to by other ways to protect the website, I’ve seen this on for apache Im just not sure if it works.

<IfModule dosevasive22_module>
DOSPageCount 2
DOSPageInterval 1
DOSBlockingPeriod 10
DOSSiteCount 50
DOSSiteInterval 1
</IfModule>
